string.name: welcome
string.value: Welcome to %brand%!

string.name: proceed
string.value: Proceed to next page

string.name: intro
string.value: %brand% can be used to access your own data from any computer that has internet access at any time at any place without installing any software.

string.name: guide
string.value: This guide will show how to use %brand%.

string.name: start
string.value: In order to start using them, the 'Launcher' application, at the left part of the screen, lists each of the application under categories, which can be clicked to be expanded to see each individual applications that you want to run.

string.name: example
string.value: For example, click on the 'Personal' category and inside the list, click on the 'Address Book' application name.

string.name: interface
string.value: The application's interface should soon appear on the screen. This guide may get hidden behind the application but clicking on the guide window again will bring it back to the front. You need to be connected to the internet at this time.

string.name: drag
string.value: You may click at an empty space inside the application where there are no scrollbars to drag the window around by moving the mouse while the button is pressed. If where clicked has a scrollbar, you cannot drag the window around to avoid the scrollbar from working.

string.name: resize
string.value: You may also click on the very right bottom corner of the application window and move the mouse to resize the application window.

string.name: cannot
string.value: However, the window cannot become smaller than its minimal possible size.

string.name: buttons
string.value: At the top right corner of the application window you should see various buttons with a title of the application and an icon on the left.

string.name: these
string.value: These buttons represent window management functions. The buttons are, from the left, a tool button, a window lock button, a window sink button, a window shrink button and a window close button.

string.name: tooltip
string.value: Tooltip can be seen on each of the buttons by keeping the mouse stay on top of it for a short moment to see what the button is for.

string.name: management
string.value: The tool button will bring up a new window to see information and configuration for that application which will be explained later.

string.name: lock
string.value: The window lock button when pressed will lock the window movement and can no longer be dragged around. Click again on the locked icon button to have the window move around again. This is useful when you need to select text inside the window by dragging mouse over it instead of letting the window move. However, you may still resize the window.

string.name: sink
string.value: The window sink button will make the current window to go behind other windows. This is useful when the currently displayed window are placed on top of other windows and you wish to interact with other windows by moving the current window behind others. You can click on a window to bring it to the front again. If there are no windows overlapping, it does nothing

string.name: shrink
string.value: The window shrink button will shrink the content of the window and shrinks it as a small window that only contains the title and the buttons. This is useful to keep application minimized when not interacting with it. Click on the button again to expand back to the original size.

string.name: close
string.value: Finally, the window close button will close the application. You may click on the application name on the 'Launcher' to run the application again retaining its state of when it was closed.

string.name: toolbar
string.value: The buttons and the application title can be hidden by clicking on the right above corner of the window to make the interface look simpler. You may click again the same corner to recover the buttons. Some applications start without the buttons, but they can be recovered as well by clicking on the right top corner of the window. This applies for any windows created but other than the main application window, the tool button will not appear.

string.name: each
string.value: For each application's detailed manual, please click on the window management button mentioned before to bring up its new window and refer to the 'Manual' section, which can be clicked to display the manual.

string.name: about
string.value: For other tabs in that window, the 'About' section describes about the application in brief and the authors' information.

string.name: history
string.value: The 'History' tab shows what has been changed since the last version of the application. For initial releases, it only states that it is the first version available. You may also refer to other version's histories if they are avaiable on the selectable option.

string.name: conf
string.value: And for the configuration tab, it lists available configuration for that application. Configuration can have multiple sections within its page shown at the top, which can be clicked to be changed for more options.

string.name: version
string.value: %brand% is made to keep multiple versions of the application available, so that the user may choose whichever version liked, which can be selected from the 'Setting' tab and in the 'General' page of it. If there is only 1 initial version available, it cannot be changed to other versions. When a new version is released for the application, that version will be automatically listed in the list of versions to choose from.

string.name: session
string.value: If you have chosen to keep the session at the login prompt, you may close the browser and keep your logged in state the next time you visit %brand% for a period of time. If you have chosen not to keep your session, then closing the browser will automatically logs the user out and you are required to log in again on the next visit. If you are on a publically available computer, it is strongly advised thatyou do not select the option to keep the session at log in.

string.name: logout
string.value: To log out manually, use the 'Logout' displayed in the 'Launcher' application and your login state will be discarded on the browser. When you log in again, your state will be recovered.

string.name: setting
string.value: In order to change system settings such as the language and the wallpaper, please clickon the 'System' category of the launcher application and click on 'Setting'. It will show a list of options to change and the 'Wallpaper' tab at the top will show a list of available wallpapers to use. You may also specify a valid web address in the input field to specify a wallpaper of your choice.

string.name: community
string.value: If you need further information, please visit the community site.

string.name: end
string.value: This concludes the guide. Please have a great use of %brand%.
